poem:
### Morning Report

At dawn, the fragile ceasefire floats,  
like a folded newspaper on the porch—  
only to unravel by mid-morning,  
numbers lining the columns,  
the dead accounted like misplaced commas.  
In Gaza, children draw new borders,  
not with crayons, but with shadows  
under an unyielding sun.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Hamas considers US ceasefire plan for Gaza – Middle East live 10.50am BST Israeli airstrikes killed 15 Palestinians in Gaza early on Friday, while another 20 people died in shootings while waiting for aid, the hospital morgue that received their bodies told The Associated Press. At least 15 people were killed in Israeli airstrikes, including eight women and one child. Another 20 were shot while waiting for aid, according to Nasser Hospital, including two who". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
